definition: lit. to attend to one thing and lose sight of another (idiom)/fig. to be unable to manage two or more things at once/cannot pay attention to one thing without neglecting the other
to look after/to take into consideration/to attend to

sentences.english: Many women with children and jobs face the conundrum of neglecting one or the other.
sentences.chinese: 很多既有孩子也有工作的婦女面臨顧此失彼的困境。

sentences.english: However, the two options will likely be in imbalance condition.
sentences.chinese: 但這兩種選擇難免會出現顧此失彼的權利失衡。

definition: (jocularly) public building that has been lying idle (and is thus ideal for housing mosquitos) (Tw)
plethora of things to tackle/multitude of loose ends/very complicated/chaotic
to take the big picture into consideration (idiom)/to work for the benefits of all
to let emotions affect one's decisions
to assess one's income and spend accordingly (idiom); to live within one's means/You can only spend what you earn.
to have no other choice/to be the last resort
pinyin: bu4 de2 yi3 er2 wei2 zhi1

definition: to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: a new branch grows out of a knot (idiom); fig. side issues keep arising
